Sentencas: Premixed safety gas is conventionally used to keep the anode of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) under reducing conditions during heat-up.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: This article presents the results of an experimental study to heat up a SOFC system and stack without the said premixed safety gases, i.e. by utilizing a natural gas pre-reformer and anode off-gas recycling (AOGR).
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: Firstly, ex-situ experiments were conducted to investigate the operability of a pre-reformer during system heat-up.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: It was found that any oxygen fed to the reformer hinders the reforming reactions at low temperatures.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: Secondly, based on the ex-situ findings, series of heat-up cycles were conducted with a complete 10 kW system using AOGR and a planar SOFC stack.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: In these experiments it was found that the system heat-up is possible with fuel gas and steam only, without the need for premixed reducing safety gases.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: Use of the fuel gas instead of a premixed safety gas did not result in a significant performance loss in the SOFC stack.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases

Sentencas: Therefore, such a heat-up strategy was developed for SOFC systems that reduces the need of premixed safety gas storage space and thus decreases the system cost.
Titulo: Experimental study of SOFC system heat-up without safety gases
